intro: Corchorus pachyphyllus, commonly known as the thick-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes or traditional uses.
